CHAPTER 20 ■Scientific Reasoning
like Calvin: since they were unaware of the complexity of cells, they found it
easy to believe that cells could originate from simple mud.
Throughout history there have been many other examples, similar to that
of Haeckel, Huxley, and the cell, where a key piece of a particular scientific
